recipes.label: Call on the Cartographer of Scars to raise a corpse to half-life
recipes.startdescription: A shattering force will infuse its flesh, so that it joins the Shattered Risen. I must begin the process. I will ready my hammer.
recipes.description: The corpse lurches groaning to its feet: or what is left of its feet. I have conjured a Shattered Risen.
recipes.comments: it's possible for a corpse to have a negative follower mutation - eg, if the follower is wounded. Let's strip it out, just in case. We could add a mutation to lose any outstanding wounds too, but I'm leery of messing too much.

recipes.label: Call on the Ring-Yew to raise a corpse to half-life
recipes.startdescription: First I must plant the seeds: under the eyelids, under the tongue, in all the secret openings of the body. It will awaken as a Burgeoning Risen.
recipes.description: The corpse sways to its feet. Its eyes struggle open. Sap trickles from its mouth. It burgeons; it has risen.
recipes.comments: it's possible for a corpse to have a negative follower mutation - eg, if the follower is wounded. Let's strip it out, just in case. We could add a mutation to lose any outstanding wounds too, but I'm leery of messing too much.

recipes.label: Call on the Cartographer of Scars to renew a corpse's half-life
recipes.startdescription: This is not really a rite of renewal - more of deferral. Winter can be delayed, but not denied.
recipes.description: The processes of decay are retarded - the motile energies re-engaged. The corpse will walk another ten hundred steps before it fails.

recipes.label: Call on the Ring-Yew to renew a corpse's half-life
recipes.startdescription: The new life within the corpse struggles to be free. I will contain it a little longer.
recipes.description: The light in the corpse's eyes grows less wild. Its tendrils are quelled. For a moment, I think it will speak.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Forge of Days
recipes.startdescription: King Crucible will come only when the room glows with the aspect called Forge. He also requires a Lantern, for the light of the Glory that he claims to know.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Forge of Days
recipes.description: He can hide in a candle-flame if he must. But here he is in all his bonfire pomp. After I speak with him, the skin of my face and hands will be pink as if from too much sun.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Red Grail
recipes.startdescription: Ezeem may enter only where the Grail's power is strong; and it will choose to enter only when invoked with the Forge, with which it has flirted so often.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Red Grail
recipes.description: So many rich aromas, like a feast upon the air! but first, and mostly, blood.

recipes.label: Summon the mysterious Name known as the Baldomerian
recipes.startdescription: A mighty force of Lantern to draw the Baldomerian's attention, and a teasing taste of secrets to bring her closer.
recipes.description: The Baldomerian has the hunched shoulders of a scholar, the clear voice of a school-teacher, and the freckles of a traveller on the Continent. She lacks a shadow.
recipes.comments: Teresa doesn't struggle; she's always up for a chat

recipes.label: Summon a creature of smoky deception
recipes.startdescription: Forge for the smoky spirit's summoning, Winter for its binding. It must know who will rule it.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of smoky deception
recipes.description: Not all the Forge's children are bright. Its offcuts and its bastards gather in the Bounds like hammerscale in the cracks of a smithy floor. Here comes one now.

recipes.label: Summon one of the more bewildering creatures of the Red Grail
recipes.startdescription: Grail for the Raw Prophet's source, and a little Moth, for its chaos-addiction.

recipes.label: Summon one of the more bewildering creatures of the Red Grail
recipes.description: It enters the world one limb at a time, questing like a serpent, cawing like a crow, throbbing like a vein. It will cuddle close against my leg, if I let it, and afterwards I will have to dispose of my shoes.

recipes.label: Summon a sharp-edged Lantern-thing
recipes.startdescription: A Hint was once a living mortal, and then a dead one, and now it's something else. Their summoning requires Lantern, for the light which drew them to the Mansus, and Edge, for the striving they've endured in mirrors.

recipes.label: Summon a sharp-edged Lantern-thing
recipes.description: The Hinter do not indulge themselves with showy entrances. A living gaze will shatter them. I know it's here, and that's enough for now.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Thunderskin
recipes.startdescription: The Percussigant, merciless and merry! Heart will bring it, Edge will constrain it.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Thunderskin
recipes.description: First the thump, the thump, the rattle and cry of the ceremonies it attends in the Wood. Now here it is, shouldering its way through the world's skin, like a clawed and ruthless uncle or a headless flapping bear.

recipes.label: Summon a servant of the Sun-in-Rags
recipes.startdescription: A deep Winter's cold to name and draw the Maid-in-the-Mirror. Edge, to match her keen cruelty.

recipes.label: Summon a servant of the Sun-in-Rags
recipes.description: The thing that was a woman has no expression of her own. The movements of her eyes and mouth always match mine, as if I were looking in a mirror. Her fingernails are sharp as glass.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Voiceless Dead
recipes.startdescription: These are the Dead who do not descend or ascend, but who remain in the Mansus and dream of Winter. The power of Winter, along with a little of the Heart's warmth, will draw them here.

recipes.label: Summon one of the Voiceless Dead
recipes.description: A dark shape limned with winter light. It will not speak, but its eyes are avid, looking, looking. The Dead always long for the world, eventually.

recipes.label: Summoning: a Rebellious Spirit
recipes.startdescription: The summoning is struggling against my control! I could use Reason to dismiss it safely, which is always reliable. I could try to reassert control with Passion, which is not reliable. Or I could let what will happen, happen.

slots.label: Effort
slots.description: I could use Reason to dismiss it safely, which is always reliable. I could try to reassert control with Passion, which is not reliable. Or I could let what will happen, happen.

recipes.label: Summoning: Sending it Home
recipes.startdescription: Pronounce the words of dismissal. Seal the circle tight. Erase every trace.

recipes.label: Summoning: Contending for Mastery
recipes.startdescription: The things from outside the world have many weapons: knives and riddles, fire and despair. I have weapons of my own. [This will usually, but not always, work.]

recipes.label: Summoning: a Breach!
recipes.description: My summoning has escaped my control, where it'll wreak havoc, no doubt -

recipes.label: Summoning: Mastery Regained!
recipes.description: My summoning will obey my wishes - for now.
